Operation 'getTime' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. The original summary 'Get the service time' is too generic and doesn't specify it's the Ably service time. The description lacks context about what the timestamp is used for, authentication requirements, and the exact response format. Enhanced version clarifies the service context, explains the epoch reference, notes no authentication is needed, provides use case context, and specifies the response structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: This returns the service time in milliseconds since the epoch.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve current Ably service server time
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current server time from the Ably service. Returns the time in milliseconds since the Unix epoch (January 1, 1970 UTC). This operation requires no authentication and is useful for synchronizing client clocks with the server. The response contains a single numeric value representing the current server timestamp.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Get the service time' is too generic and doesn't specify it's the Ably service time. The description lacks context about what the timestamp is used for, authentication requirements, and the exact response format. Enhanced version clarifies the service context, explains the epoch reference, notes no authentication is needed, provides use case context, and specifies the response structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Get a list of push notification subscriptions to channels.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of push notification subscriptions to channels. Supports filtering by channel name and client ID. Returns subscription details including device identifiers, channel names, and subscription metadata. Requires authentication.
data.reasoning: Original description is too brief and lacks details about pagination, filtering capabilities, return structure, and authentication requirements. Enhanced version provides clarity on inputs (filters), outputs (subscription details), and authentication context for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'deletePushDeviceDetails' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary mentions 'update token' which is inconsistent with the endpoint path (/push/channelSubscriptions) and operation context. Description is extremely vague about what is actually being deleted. Enhanced version clarifies that this deletes a channel subscription (not device registration), specifies required parameters, explains the effect (no more notifications), and distinguishes from device deletion for AI agent clarity.

data.current_summary: Delete a registered device's update token
data.description_suggestion: Removes a device's push notification subscription from a channel. Requires device ID and channel name as parameters. After deletion, the device will no longer receive push notifications for messages sent to that channel. Returns a success confirmation. This operation does not delete the device registration itself, only the channel subscription.
data.reasoning: Original summary mentions 'update token' which is inconsistent with the endpoint path (/push/channelSubscriptions) and operation context. Description is extremely vague about what is actually being deleted. Enhanced version clarifies that this deletes a channel subscription (not device registration), specifies required parameters, explains the effect (no more notifications), and distinguishes from device deletion for AI agent clarity.

data.current_summary: List all channels with at least one subscribed device

data.current_summary: Publish a push notification to device(s)
data.current_description: A convenience endpoint to deliver a push notification payload to a single device or set of devices identified by their client identifier.
data.description_suggestion: Delivers a push notification payload directly to one or more devices identified by device ID or client identifier. Accepts notification content, target device(s), and optional metadata. Returns confirmation of delivery with message ID and status. Notifications are queued for immediate delivery to push service providers. Requires authentication.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description lacks specificity about input requirements (what constitutes a valid payload, how to specify targets), output structure (confirmation details), and side effects (queuing behavior, delivery guarantees). Enhanced version clarifies inputs, outputs, and operational behavior for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'requestAccessToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary lacks domain specificity ('Ably' context). Description is verbose with SDK recommendations and documentation links that distract from the core operation. Enhanced version focuses on the actual operation (exchange TokenRequest for token), clarifies inputs (TokenRequest or Signed TokenRequest), outputs (TokenDetails with specific fields), authentication requirements, and the token's purpose for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description: This is the means by which clients obtain access tokens to use the service. You can see how to construct an Ably TokenRequest in the [Ably TokenRequest spec](https://www.ably.io/documentation/rest-api/token-request-spec) documentation, although we recommend you use an Ably SDK rather to create a TokenRequest, as the construction of a TokenRequest is complex. The resulting token response object contains the token properties as defined in Ably TokenRequest spec. Authentication is not required if using a Signed TokenRequest.
data.description_suggestion: Exchanges a TokenRequest for an access token (TokenDetails) to authenticate with the Ably service. Accepts either a TokenRequest object or a Signed TokenRequest. Returns a TokenDetails object containing the token string, expiration time, and capabilities. Authentication is not required when using a Signed TokenRequest. Tokens are used for subsequent API requests via Bearer authentication.
data.reasoning: Summary lacks domain specificity ('Ably' context). Description is verbose with SDK recommendations and documentation links that distract from the core operation. Enhanced version focuses on the actual operation (exchange TokenRequest for token), clarifies inputs (TokenRequest or Signed TokenRequest), outputs (TokenDetails with specific fields), authentication requirements, and the token's purpose for AI agent clarity.

data.current_summary: Publish a message to a channel
data.current_description: Publish a message to the specified channel
data.description_suggestion: Publishes a Message object to the specified channel, making it available to all subscribers. Requires authentication and publish permissions on the channel. Returns the published message with server-assigned metadata including timestamp and message ID. Messages are persisted according to channel retention settings.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve current presence members on a channel
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current presence state for the specified channel, including all members currently present. Returns an array of PresenceMessage objects containing member identifiers, connection state, and metadata. Supports pagination through query parameters. Requires authentication and presence permissions.

data.current_summary: Get presence history of a channel
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves historical presence events for the specified channel, including member join, leave, and update events. Supports pagination and time-range filtering. Returns an array of PresenceMessage objects ordered by timestamp. Requires authentication and presence permissions. History retention depends on channel configuration.
data.reasoning: Description incorrectly states 'Get presence on a channel' which is identical to current presence operation, creating confusion. Should clarify this retrieves historical events, not current state. Missing details about event types, filtering, and retention.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieves metadata for the specified channel, including channel status, occupancy information, and configuration details. Returns a ChannelDetails object containing channel state and occupancy metrics. Requires authentication and appropriate channel permissions.

message: Operation 'putPushDeviceDetails' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context. Summary doesn't distinguish PUT (replace) from PATCH (partial update). Description mentions upsert but could be clearer about the replace-entire behavior and the distinction from PATCH. Added clarity about immutable fields and return value for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Device registrations can be upserted (the existing registration is replaced entirely) with a PUT operation. Only clientId, metadata and push.recipient are mutable.
data.summary_suggestion: Replace or create a device registration
data.description_suggestion: Replaces an existing device registration entirely (upsert operation). If the device exists, the entire registration is replaced; if it doesn't exist, a new registration is created. Only clientId, metadata, and push.recipient fields are mutable; other fields are immutable. Returns the updated or newly created DeviceDetails object.
data.reasoning: Summary doesn't distinguish PUT (replace) from PATCH (partial update). Description mentions upsert but could be clearer about the replace-entire behavior and the distinction from PATCH. Added clarity about immutable fields and return value for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'patchPushDeviceDetails' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is identical to PUT operation, creating ambiguity. PATCH should be distinguished as partial update. Description doesn't explain that omitted fields are preserved or what the response contains. Improved summary and description clarify the partial update semantics.

data.current_description: Specific attributes of an existing registration can be updated. Only clientId, metadata and push.recipient are mutable.
data.description_suggestion: Performs a partial update on an existing device registration. Only the provided fields are modified; omitted fields retain their current values. Only clientId, metadata, and push.recipient are mutable. Returns the updated DeviceDetails object with all current field values.
data.reasoning: Summary is identical to PUT operation, creating ambiguity. PATCH should be distinguished as partial update. Description doesn't explain that omitted fields are preserved or what the response contains. Improved summary and description clarify the partial update semantics.

message: Operation 'updatePushDeviceDetails' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, not_actionable, missing_output_details. Summary mentions 'reset' but description says 'gets', creating confusion about the actual action. Description is vague about what 'updated device details object' means and why this endpoint exists. The GET method on a 'resetUpdateToken' path is semantically unclear. Improved summary and description clarify that this generates a new token and explain its purpose for device registration updates.

data.current_summary: Reset a registered device's update token
data.current_description: Gets an updated device details object.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate a new device update token
data.description_suggestion: Generates a new update token for a registered device, enabling it to refresh its registration details. This token is required for the device to perform subsequent updates to its registration. Returns the updated DeviceDetails object including the new update token.
data.reasoning: Summary mentions 'reset' but description says 'gets', creating confusion about the actual action. Description is vague about what 'updated device details object' means and why this endpoint exists. The GET method on a 'resetUpdateToken' path is semantically unclear. Improved summary and description clarify that this generates a new token and explain its purpose for device registration updates.
